        public void setStyle(HIStyle style)

        public void setVerticalAlign(java.lang.String verticalAlign)
        Vertical alignment of the label relative to the plot line. Can be one of "top", "middle" or "bottom".

        Try it:

         •  Vertically centered label

        accepted values:

         ["top", "middle", "bottom"]

        default:

         top

      • setAlign

        public void setAlign(java.lang.String align)
        Horizontal alignment of the label. Can be one of "left", "center" or "right".

        Try it:

         •  Aligned to the right

        accepted values:

         ["center", "left", "right"]

        default:

         left

      • getAlign

        public java.lang.String getAlign()

      • setTextAlign

        public void setTextAlign(java.lang.String textAlign)
        The text alignment for the label. While align determines where the texts anchor point is placed within the plot band, textAlign determines how the text is aligned against its anchor point. Possible values are "left", "center" and "right". Defaults to the same as the align option.

        Try it:

         •  Text label in bottom position

      • getTextAlign

        public java.lang.String getTextAlign()

      • setY

        public void setY(java.lang.Number y)
        Vertical position of the text baseline relative to the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

        Try it:

         •  Label below the plot line

      • getY

        public java.lang.Number getY()

      • setX

        public void setX(java.lang.Number x)
        Horizontal position relative the alignment. Default varies by orientation.

        Try it:

         •  Aligned 10px from the right edge

      • getX

        public java.lang.Number getX()

      • setRotation

        public void setRotation(java.lang.Number rotation)
        Rotation of the text label in degrees. Defaults to 0 for horizontal plot lines and 90 for vertical lines.

        Try it:

         •  Slanted text

        public void setUseHTML(java.lang.Boolean useHTML)

        default:

         false

      • getUseHTML

      • setMinFontSize

        public void setMinFontSize(java.lang.Number minFontSize)
        For area-like series, allow the font size to vary so that small areas get a smaller font size. The default applies this effect to area-like series but not line-like series.

      • getMinFontSize

        public java.lang.Number getMinFontSize()

      • setMaxFontSize

        public void setMaxFontSize(java.lang.Number maxFontSize)
        For area-like series, allow the font size to vary so that small areas get a smaller font size. The default applies this effect to area-like series but not line-like series.

      • setOnArea

        public void setOnArea(java.lang.Boolean onArea)
        Draw the label on the area of an area series. By default it is drawn on the area. Set it to false to draw it next to the graph instead.

      • getOnArea

        public java.lang.Boolean getOnArea()

      • setBoxesToAvoid

        public void setBoxesToAvoid(java.util.ArrayList boxesToAvoid)
        An array of boxes to avoid when laying out the labels. Each item has a left, right, top and bottom property.

      • getBoxesToAvoid

        public java.util.ArrayList getBoxesToAvoid()

      • setConnectorAllowed

        public void setConnectorAllowed(java.lang.Boolean connectorAllowed)
        Allow labels to be placed distant to the graph if necessary, and draw a connector line to the graph. Setting this option to true may decrease the performance significantly, since the algorithm with systematically search for open spaces in the while plot area. Visually, it may also result in a more cluttered chart, though more of the series will be labeled.

      • getConnectorAllowed

        public java.lang.Boolean getConnectorAllowed()
